author: Staff Reporter
text:
Vinod Raj was returning from Bengaluru after attending an interview.

Twenty three-year-old Vinod Raj was fatally run over while jumping off the Mangalore-Puducherry Express (Train no. 16857) on Saturday at Villianur.

A resident of Kombakkam near Villianur, Vinod Raj was returning from Bengaluru after attending an interview on Friday. He was supposed to travel in a passenger train but boarded the Mangalore-Puducherry Express.

Police inspector Arumugam said that the train slowed down in Sultanpet near Villianur at 10.50 a.m.

Vinod Raj tried to alight from the moving train as this place was closer to his house. There were few friends who were waiting for him at Villinaur.

But when he alighted; he slipped on the platform and fell onto the tracks. The speeding train cut his body into several pieces and his mutilated body parts were strewn around.

The body was sent to post-mortem. He is survived by his parents and elder sister.
title: Youth killed while jumping off train near Puducherry
